title: Calories in Yoshinoya Beef Bowl
meta_description: Discover calories in Yoshinoya beef bowl, including macros like protein and carbs, plus variations and FAQs for their popular gyudon menu item.
assumptions: Regular size Yoshinoya beef bowl (gyudon) with steamed rice, thinly sliced beef, onions, and soy-based sauce; no extras like egg or cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, portion size, preparation, and customizations. Values based on standard U.S. Yoshinoya menu; check official app or site for latest.

quick_answer.text: A regular Yoshinoya beef bowl contains about 760 kcal, with high carbs from rice and solid protein from beef.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with menu info.

faqs.q: How many calories in Yoshinoya regular beef bowl?
faqs.a: Approximately 760 kcal for the standard regular size.

faqs.q: What are the macros for calories in Yoshinoya gyudon?
faqs.a: About 105 g carbs, 32 g protein, 25 g fat per regular bowl.

faqs.q: Is Yoshinoya beef bowl high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1820 mg sodium per bowl due to the soy sauce.

faqs.q: Calories in Yoshinoya with extra toppings?
faqs.a: Adding egg or cheese increases calories by 70â€“150 kcal; check customizations.

faqs.q: How does Yoshinoya compare to other fast food rice bowls?
faqs.a: Similar to teriyaki bowls, but Yoshinoya's is often higher in sodium and carbs from rice.
